# React + Vite

This template provides a minimal setup to get React working in Vite with HMR and some ESLint rules.

Currently, two official plugins are available:

- [@vitejs/plugin-react](https://github.com/vitejs/vite-plugin-react/blob/main/packages/plugin-react/README.md) uses [Babel](https://babeljs.io/) for Fast Refresh
- [@vitejs/plugin-react-swc](https://github.com/vitejs/vite-plugin-react-swc) uses [SWC](https://swc.rs/) for Fast Refresh

hello

this is the image slider app made by me Jagannath sahoo.
 this project is the part of my react 100 project challenge that give my self
 in this challenge i make 100 project by using Reactjs
 and this is the first project for my challenge 

   # React + Vite (project No. 1-99)
        


## 1. what is this project ?

this is an image slider to slide your localy stord image. suppose you have 1000 of image on your computer and try to 
        see them but can you see all the images one by one. first open the image and close them and after that open 
        the other image it vary inconvenient way so that is why we ned a app that show our image just one click.
        not only that but all so try to see next image just click next button and see this.and much more stuff are available in this app.

## 2. step of making this app ?
__NO.1 installation step__

Step A-----> Creat #React+vite app by using npm



```bash
  npm create vite@latest my-project -- --template react
```
step B----> run your #React+vite app
```bash
   npm run dev 
```
remember all the step are work only if you install nodejs and npm package manager on your computer. if you are not install nodejs&npm first install them and then try to this 
two step 

Step C----> install tailwind CSS
```bash
npm install -D tailwindcss postcss autoprefixer
npx tailwindcss init -p
```
now further step you can go to official document of tailwindcss.

__click this logo go to tailwindcss official guides__
  
[![twitter](data:image/jpeg;base64,)](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/guides/vite)

__NO.2 make a previous and next button__

in this step i creact previous and next button by using simple __if elas__ statement to see my this next and previus button logic go to

```bash
  ./src/und.jsx
  ```
  
  


    if(count < JsoneFind_length -1){
      setprevCount(count)
      setCount(count +1)
    }else{
      setCount("img is not available ")
    }if(count == "img is not available "){
      setCount(0)
    } 
    }const remove_value = () => {
    if(count !== "img is not available " && count > 0){
      setCount(count - 1)
    }else{
      setCount(prevCount)
    }if(count == 0 || count == "img is not available "){
      setCount(JsoneFind_length -1)
    }};
    

  and this step result are stored in count variable by    using react __usestate hook__  

__NO.3 bring the data inside inside of the json file__

my actuall image stored in public folders

```bash
./public/img
  ```
but i use json to bring my all image data becues i am not only fetch the image but all so fetch some text and color. 
that is why i use json to organize my data.

    {
    "items": [
    {
      "id": 0,
    "name": "Create a minimalist artistic representation of a d",
    "directory": "./img/1 (0).png",
    "color": "#D46F4A"
    },
    ]
    }

now remember this in not a only way to make this application they are
 multiple way to do same things and if you try to use anther way you can safely use them.

but this is the most optimis way.

__NO.4 display image__

to display the image i use card react component 

    import React from 'react'
    export default function card(props) {
    return (
        
            <>
            <div className="card m-3 bg-black" style={
              {width: "82rem" , height: "35rem"}}>
                <div className="card-body">
                            <img src={`${props.imgNo}`} alt="" />
                    <p className={`card-text text-justify`} 
                    style=
                    {{"color": `${props.textcolor}`,"text-align": "center"}}>
                    {`${props.name || " "}`}</p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </>
    )
    }

i can pass source of the image inside of the img tag 
and some word that explen about the highlight of the image, after that pass color of the highlight text.

__NO.5 import the component__

now import this component into the __und__ component which is contain all the main logic 

    import Card from "./card";

  use this component inside of the und file

    {currentItem && (<Card name={`${currentItem.name}`} imgNo={currentItem.directory} textcolor={currentItem.color}/>)}
    {!currentItem && (<Card imgNo={'./img/not.png'}/>)}

this is the simple but most impotent project of the new reactjs learner.this project give you the significant idea and detailed knowledge about the Reactjs,useState hook and in general hooks.
